newsitem.title: USA: Talley holder files stock list suit.
newsitem.headline: Talley holder files stock list suit.

text.p: Saudi investor Saad Alissa, a major stockholder in Talley Industries Inc said Wednesday he filed a lawsuit seeking copies of or access to the stock ledger, shareholder list and related documents.
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Alissa said filed the suit on behalf of a coalition in Chancery Court in the state of Delware on February 21.

He also filed proxy materials with the SEC reflecting the nomination of Robert Craig, Ralph Rockow and George Sawyer, a former Assistant Secretary of the Navy to the company's board of directors and five shareholder proposals.
The proposals include the recommendation the board eliminate certain provisions of the Talley's certificate of incorporation and bylaws that inhibit stockholder action.

It also calls for the elimination of the "poison pill" plan first adopted and then extended without stockholder action and retain an independent investment banker to evaluate the company's businesses and assist the board in a restructuring program.
A group led by Alissa controls 1,121,000 common shares or 7.55 percent of the total outstanding shares.
